intro: Thlaspi alpestre subsp. merinoi, commonly known as the Merino's rockcress, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many economically important plants such as mustard and cabbage. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Its small, white or yellowish flowers are arranged in clusters and bloom in late spring to early summer. The species is characterized by its robust, low-growing habit and distinctive, elongated leaves.
